verses.kjv: And Samuel said unto all Israel, Behold, I have hearkened unto your voice in all that ye said unto me, and have made a king over you.
verses.ct: Samuel addressed all of Israel: "Listen, I have done everything you asked of me and appointed a king over you.

verses.kjv: And now, behold, the king walketh before you: and I am old and grayheaded; and, behold, my sons are with you: and I have walked before you from my childhood unto this day.
verses.ct: Now the king is the one leading you. As for me, I'm old and gray, and my sons are here among you. I have served as your leader from the time I was young until today.

verses.kjv: Behold, here I am: witness against me before the LORD, and before his anointed: whose ox have I taken? or whose ass have I taken? or whom have I defrauded? whom have I oppressed? or of whose hand have I received any bribe to blind mine eyes therewith? and I will restore it you.
verses.ct: Here I stand. Bring any accusation against me in the presence of the LORD and his anointed king. Whose ox have I stolen? Whose donkey have I taken? Have I cheated anyone? Have I oppressed anyone? Have I ever accepted a bribe to look the other way? If so, I will pay it back."

verses.kjv: And they said, Thou hast not defrauded us, nor oppressed us, neither hast thou taken ought of any man’s hand.
verses.ct: They replied, "You have never cheated us or oppressed us, and you have never taken anything from anyone."

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, The LORD is witness against you, and his anointed is witness this day, that ye have not found ought in my hand. And they answered, He is witness.
verses.ct: He told them, "The LORD is a witness against you, and his anointed king is a witness today, that you have found nothing wrong in how I've led you." They answered, "He is a witness."

verses.kjv: And Samuel said unto the people, It is the LORD that advanced Moses and Aaron, and that brought your fathers up out of the land of Egypt.
verses.ct: Then Samuel said to the people, "It was the LORD who raised up Moses and Aaron and who brought your ancestors out of Egypt.

verses.kjv: Now therefore stand still, that I may reason with you before the LORD of all the righteous acts of the LORD, which he did to you and to your fathers.
verses.ct: Now stand here so I can present my case to you in the LORD's presence, reminding you of all the righteous things the LORD has done for you and your ancestors.

verses.kjv: When Jacob was come into Egypt, and your fathers cried unto the LORD, then the LORD sent Moses and Aaron, which brought forth your fathers out of Egypt, and made them dwell in this place.
verses.ct: After Jacob went to Egypt and your ancestors cried out to the LORD for help, the LORD sent Moses and Aaron, who led your ancestors out of Egypt and settled them in this land.

verses.kjv: And when they forgat the LORD their God, he sold them into the hand of Sisera, captain of the host of Hazor, and into the hand of the Philistines, and into the hand of the king of Moab, and they fought against them.
verses.ct: But they forgot the LORD their God, so he handed them over to Sisera, the commander of Hazor's army, and to the Philistines, and to the king of Moab, who all waged war against them.

verses.kjv: And they cried unto the LORD, and said, We have sinned, because we have forsaken the LORD, and have served Baalim and Ashtaroth: but now deliver us out of the hand of our enemies, and we will serve thee.
verses.ct: Then they cried out to the LORD and said, 'We have sinned because we abandoned the LORD and worshiped the Baals and the Ashtoreths. But now rescue us from our enemies, and we will serve you.'

verses.kjv: And the LORD sent Jerubbaal, and Bedan, and Jephthah, and Samuel, and delivered you out of the hand of your enemies on every side, and ye dwelled safe.
verses.ct: So the LORD sent Jerubbaal, Bedan, Jephthah, and Samuel, and he rescued you from your enemies on every side, and you lived in safety.

verses.kjv: And when ye saw that Nahash the king of the children of Ammon came against you, ye said unto me, Nay; but a king shall reign over us: when the LORD your God was your king.
verses.ct: But when you saw Nahash, king of the Ammonites, coming to attack you, you said to me, 'No — we want a king to rule over us,' even though the LORD your God was already your king.

verses.kjv: Now therefore behold the king whom ye have chosen, and whom ye have desired! and, behold, the LORD hath set a king over you.
verses.ct: So now, here is the king you have chosen, the one you asked for. The LORD has placed a king over you.

verses.kjv: If ye will fear the LORD, and serve him, and obey his voice, and not rebel against the commandment of the LORD, then shall both ye and also the king that reigneth over you continue following the LORD your God:
verses.ct: If you will deeply revere the LORD, serve him, listen to him, and not rebel against his commands, then both you and the king who rules over you will continue to follow the LORD your God.

verses.kjv: But if ye will not obey the voice of the LORD, but rebel against the commandment of the LORD, then shall the hand of the LORD be against you, as it was against your fathers.
verses.ct: But if you refuse to listen to the LORD and rebel against his commands, then the LORD will turn against you, just as he did against your ancestors.

verses.kjv: Now therefore stand and see this great thing, which the LORD will do before your eyes.
verses.ct: Now stand here and watch this remarkable thing the LORD is about to do right in front of you.

verses.kjv: Is it not wheat harvest to day? I will call unto the LORD, and he shall send thunder and rain; that ye may perceive and see that your wickedness is great, which ye have done in the sight of the LORD, in asking you a king.
verses.ct: Isn't this the wheat harvest season? I will call on the LORD, and he will send thunder and rain. Then you will understand and recognize how terrible your sin was in the LORD's sight when you demanded a king."

verses.kjv: So Samuel called unto the LORD; and the LORD sent thunder and rain that day: and all the people greatly feared the LORD and Samuel.
verses.ct: Samuel called on the LORD, and that very day the LORD sent thunder and rain. All the people were deeply afraid of the LORD and of Samuel.

verses.kjv: And all the people said unto Samuel, Pray for thy servants unto the LORD thy God, that we die not: for we have added unto all our sins this evil, to ask us a king.
verses.ct: All the people pleaded with Samuel, "Pray to the LORD your God for us, your servants, so that we don't die! We realize that on top of all our other sins, we added this evil of demanding a king."

verses.kjv: And Samuel said unto the people, Fear not: ye have done all this wickedness: yet turn not aside from following the LORD, but serve the LORD with all your heart;
verses.ct: Samuel told the people, "Don't be afraid. Yes, you have done all this evil. But don't turn away from following the LORD. Instead, serve the LORD with your whole heart.

verses.kjv: And turn ye not aside: for then should ye go after vain things, which cannot profit nor deliver; for they are vain.
verses.ct: Don't turn aside to chase after worthless things that can't help you or rescue you, because they are empty and useless.

verses.kjv: For the LORD will not forsake his people for his great name’s sake: because it hath pleased the LORD to make you his people.
verses.ct: The LORD will not abandon his people, for the sake of his great reputation, because it pleased the LORD to make you his own people.

verses.kjv: Moreover as for me, God forbid that I should sin against the LORD in ceasing to pray for you: but I will teach you the good and the right way:
verses.ct: As for me, I would never sin against the LORD by stopping my prayers for you. I will continue to teach you the good and right path.

verses.kjv: Only fear the LORD, and serve him in truth with all your heart: for consider how great things he hath done for you.
verses.ct: Only be wholeheartedly dedicated to the LORD and serve him faithfully with your whole heart. Think about the incredible things he has done for you.

verses.kjv: But if ye shall still do wickedly, ye shall be consumed, both ye and your king.
verses.ct: But if you persist in doing evil, both you and your king will be destroyed."
